page.title: 19ITCHEN NAVIGATION CANAL
page.content: Romans were first to use the river for carrying building materials on barges. 1795 Barton river was repaired and locks constructed.Barges carrying coal were pulled by horses walking on towpaths.When the barges went under bridges the horses were led round the side.The men on the boat put there feet on the side of the tunnel and pushed themselves along.These men were called leggers and the bargees.Bargees could not be press ganged into the navy because they had a certificate from the mayor.6 barges usually went up at any one time.1867 the canal was no longer used for traffic.1869 the last barge of coal went up the canal because steam engines had taken over.Vibration from the engine destroyed locks.tthe railway was responsible for payment.Today it is used for fishing and ecology etc.
